thread.section_title: Australian Business & World Finance News - Yahoo!7 Finance
thread.title: $A lower amid risk-off trade

title: $A lower amid risk-off trade
text:
Print 
The Australian dollar is weaker after US and European share markets and commodity prices fell overnight. 
At 0700 AEST on Wednesday, the local unit was trading at 70.91 US cents, down from 71.52 cents on Tuesday. 
Movements overnight have been driven by equity market falls in the US and Europe, OM Financial senior client advisor FX Stuart Ive said. 
"Overnight equities fell and commodities continued to drop. There is a general risk-off tone," he said. 
Investors and traders are also nervously waiting for key Chinese manufacturing data due on Wednesday at 1145 AEST. 
Mr Ive said the Aussie dollar could lose more ground even if the data was positive. 
"If the Chinese data comes out better than expected, the Aussie dollar can still come under pressure because it will increase expectations of a US rates hike in October," he said. 
"If the data is weak, again the Aussie will fall as the global markets will continue its risk-off unwinding of trade." 
KEY MOVEMENTS: 
* 70.91 US cents, from 71.52 cents on Tuesday 
* 85.19 Japanese yen, from 86.06 yen 
* 63.76 euro cents, from 64.01 euro cents 
* 112.65 New Zealand cents, from 113.01 NZ cents 
* 46.13 British pence, from 46.15 pence 
Source: IRESS
